definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: He cut the third way between the empiricism and the rationalism.
sentences.chinese: 他在经验论与唯理论之间开辟了第三条道路。
经验论的对立面是唯理论。

sentences.english: The opposite of empiricism is rationalism .
sentences.chinese: 经验论的对立面是唯理论。

definition: epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
voluntarism/metaphysical view, esp. due to Schopenhauer 叔本華|叔本华[Shu1 ben3 hua2], that the essence of the world is willpower
